info.title: PROCEED Management System API
info.description:
### About us
PROCEED is a decentralized Business Process Management System (dBPMS) specialized on the creation, execution and monitoring of individual IoT processes. The execution is done decentralized without a controlling instance. Instead there are multiple machines that cooperate with each other to achieve the designed process goal. Thereby, all machines communicate their capabilities to the vicinity and the process is taking the best fitting one for its next execution ##step.

### More resources: 
- [Documentation](https://docs.proceed-labs.org/)
- [Wiki](https://github.com/PROCEED-Labs/proceed/wiki)

tags.name: Process
tags.description: All endpoints that deal with processes.

tags.description: All endpoints that deal with the auth system's roles.

tags.description: All endpoints that deal with the auth system's roles mappings.

tags.name: Resources
tags.description: All endpoints that deal with system resources as viewed by the authorization system.

parameters.name: noBpmn
parameters.description: If set to true, no BPM XML is sent back

get.description: Get all processes you can view.

303.description: There already exists a process with the given id

400.description: The body of the request does not conform to the schma of a process

500.description: Failed to create the process due an internal error

get.description: Get a porcess by it's id.

400.description: Error getting the bpmn of the process

404.description: No Process with the given definitionId was found

put.description: Updates a **partial** set of properties (this means, that arbitrarily many properties can be left out).

description.description: The description (the content of documentation element of the first process element in the process model)

definitionName.description: The name as it is in the definitions element of the process

schema.description: Partial set of key:value properties of the Process scheme

400.description: Request body doesn't contain a partial set of key:value properties of the Process scheme

404.description: No Process with the given definitionId was found
No Process with the given definitionId was found

schema.description: Array of the versions of the process

404.description: No Process with the given definitionId was found

get.description: Get all the versions of a process.

post.description: Post a new version of a process.

get.description: Get a specific version of a process.
Get all images used in a process.
Get a specific image og a process.
Get all user tasks used in a process.

parameters.name: userTaskFileName
parameters.description: Filename of the user task html file

200.description: Plain html of the user task

get.description: Get a specific user task of a process.

put.description:
Update a specific user task of a process.
If userTaskFileName exists, then it is updated with the body of the request (200 response), if not, then the user task is created (201 response).

parameters.name: userTaskFileName
parameters.description: Filename of the user task html file

requestBody.description: HTML for the userTaskFile in plain text

201.description: User task HTML created in the server

parameters.name: userTaskFileName
parameters.description: Filename of the user task html file

200.description: The request returns 200 wether the userTaskFile exists or not

delete.description: Delete a specific user task of a process.

post.description:
Store a machine.

One of the following criteria has to be met in order for the machine to be posted:
- machine.ip and machine.port have to be set
- machine.hostname has to be set
- machine.id has to be set

get.description: Get a stored machine by it's id.

400.description: Possible causes: The body of the request is not a JSON object or the machine is not stored and thus can't be changed.

put.description: Update a machine by it's id.

200.description: OK (This is the response, even if the machine is not known)

403.description: The machine is known through the discovery and not stored. It can't be removed!

delete.description: Delete a machine by it's id.

put.description: Update the password of a user.

get.description: Get all roles of the authorization system.
Get all role mappings between users and roles.

200.description: All the roles of a user

get.description: Get all role mappings referencing a specific user.
Get all resources available in the system.

definitionId.description: The id as it is in the definitions element of the process

definitionName.description: The name as it is in the definitions element of the process

description.description: The description (the content of documentation element of the first process element in the process model)

processIds.description: The date and time the process was edited the last time

variables.description: The variables supposed to be used in the process

createdOn.description: The date and time the process was added in the management-system

lastEdited.description: The date and time the process was edited the last time

versions.description: The explicit versions of the process that were created by users

inEditingBy.description: Information about the clients that are editing the process, used in the server version for collaborative editing

id.description: The id of the client editing this process

task.description: Id of the task this client is editing

shared.description: If true, then a share link was created for the process

x-csrf-token.name: Cross-site request forgery token
x-csrf-token.description: Cross-site request forgery token obtained after logging in.

x-csrf.name: Cross-site request forgery enabled
x-csrf.description: Needs to be set to '1' in order for the x-csrf-token to be acknowledged by the server and make authenticated requests.

id.name: Session id
id.description: Session id given by the server after logging in.
